eth-to-rsk-patience.question: Transferred tokens from Ethereum, and after 24 hours have not received tokens on RSK
eth-to-rsk-patience.answer:
24 hours is an approximation, it is not exact.
Wait until `5760` blocks have been confirmed since the transaction block number, plus 5 minutes.
Your transaction `${txHash}` currently has only waited for `${txAge}` blocks.

eth-to-rsk-patience-support.question: Transferred tokens from Ethereum, and after 24 hours have not received tokens on RSK
eth-to-rsk-patience-support.answer:
Look at the **same address** on an RSK block explorer:
[`${txFrom}`](https://explorer.rsk.co/address/${txFrom}?__tab=tokens).
If you do not see the correct balance in the tokens tab, please share your transaction hash in the *#tokenbridge* channel on RSK Open slack (go to [developers.rsk.co/slack](https://developers.rsk.co/slack/) to join).

rsk-to-eth-patience.question: Transferred tokens from RSK, and after 24 hours have not received tokens on Ethereum
rsk-to-eth-patience.answer:
24 hours is an approximation, it is not exact.
Wait until `2880` blocks have been confirmed since the transaction block number, plus 5 minutes.
Your transaction `${txHash}` currently has only waited for `${txAge}` blocks.

rsk-to-eth-patience-support.question: Transferred tokens from RSK, and after 24 hours have not received tokens on Ethereum
rsk-to-eth-patience-support.answer:
Look at the **same address** on an Ethereum block explorer:
[`${txFrom}`](https://etherscan.io/address/${txFrom}#tokentxns).
If you do not see the correct balance in the tokens tab, please share your transaction hash in the *#tokenbridge* channel on RSK Open slack (go to [developers.rsk.co/slack](https://developers.rsk.co/slack/) to join).

eth-to-rsk-liquality.question: Transferred tokens from Ethereum to RSK, but do not see them in Liquality
eth-to-rsk-liquality.answer:
RSK has a different derivation path (`m/44'/137'/0'/0`) from Ethereum (`m/44'/60'/0'/0`).
Liquality respects this convention.
Copy your mnemonic or private key and use Metamask and add RSK as custom network, to get the same address as ethereum.

rsk-to-eth-liquality.question: Transferred tokens from RSK to Ethereum, but do not see them in Liquality
rsk-to-eth-liquality.answer: RSK has a different derivation path (m/44'/137'/0'/0) from Ethereum (m/44'/60'/0'/0). Liquality respects this convention. Copy your mnemonic or private key and use My Ether Wallet or My Crypto with the RSK derivation path m/44'/137'/0'/0 to get the same address as RSK.

eth-to-rsk-nifty.question: Transferred tokens from Ethereum to RSK, but do not see them in Nifty
eth-to-rsk-nifty.answer: RSK has a different derivation path (`m/44'/137'/0'/0`) from Ethereum (`m/44'/60'/0'/0`). Nifty respects this convention. In Nifty, add RSK as Custom RPC, to get the same address as ethereum, see: https://developers.rsk.co/tutorials/resolve-nifty-issue/

rsk-to-eth-nifty.question: Transferred tokens from RSK to Ethereum, but do not see them in Nifty
rsk-to-eth-nifty.answer:
RSK has a different derivation path (`m/44'/137'/0'/0`) from Ethereum (`m/44'/60'/0'/0`).
Nifty respects this convention.
Copy your mnemonic or private key and use My Ether Wallet or My Crypto with the RSK derivation path (`m/44'/137'/0'/0`) to get the same address as RSK.

eth-to-rsk-metamask-timeout.question: Metamask threw an error
eth-to-rsk-metamask-timeout.answer:
This is usually a timeout as the Transaction was not mined on the time expected by Metamask.
This does not mean that transaction has not been mined.
Please share your transaction hash in the *#tokenbridge* channel on RSK Open slack (go to [developers.rsk.co/slack](https://developers.rsk.co/slack/) to join).

patience.question: Why does it take 24 hours? Can it be faster?
patience.answer:
This is a security measure.
24 hours is an approximation, it is not exact.
We are working to reduce this time in the next version.

address-choice.question: Why can't I choose the address?
address-choice.answer:
Currently it uses the token bridge always sends tokens to the same address on the other blockchain network, and so the sender and the receiver will always have the same address.
You will have the option to send to another address in the next version.

tx-history.question: I don't see my transaction on the Token Bridge list
tx-history.answer:
The list is stored in local cache, so it's not shared across devices, and its erased if you clear your browser cookies and temporary files.
You can be sure than if the transaction is mined the tokens will cross no matter what the list says.
If this is not the reason why it is not there please let us know in the *#tokenbridge* channel on RSK Open slack (go to [developers.rsk.co/slack](https://developers.rsk.co/slack/) to join).

used-sovryn-tokenbridge.question: I used the Sovryn Token Bridge
used-sovryn-tokenbridge.answer: If you have used `bridge.sovryn.app`, note that, this is **not** the same as the RSK Token Bridge. To get support, please ask on the [Sovryn discord group](https://discord.com/channels/729675474665603133/813119624098611260).

rsk-eth-token-send-error.question: I sent RSK tokens to an Ethereum address
rsk-eth-token-send-error.answer: Note that if you have tokens on the RSK network, such as RIF or RDOC, including **crossed** tokens such as rUSDT or rDAI, you **should not** send them to an Ethereum address in a regular transaction. This **does not** work! Instead, you should use the RSK Token Bridge to cross the tokens from one blockchain to the other.
